definition: immediately/without a moment's hesitation/with alacrity/firing from the hip

sentences.english: There are times when I sit down and have a good weep.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我会坐下来痛痛快快地哭一场。

sentences.english: We are just going to make a night of it.
sentences.chinese: 我们要痛痛快快的玩它一个晚上。

sentences.english: I would have a good long cry, and clasping you in my arms.
sentences.chinese: 我一定会抱住你，痛痛快快地哭一场。

sentences.english: Tom did play hookey, and he had a very good time.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆真的没去上课，而且痛痛快快地玩了一场。

sentences.english: I played some great games at their booth.
sentences.chinese: 我在他们的小商亭里痛痛快快玩了一回。

sentences.english: He can tuck in three or four sandwiches between meals.
sentences.chinese: 他在两顿饭之间，还能痛痛快快地吃下三四块三明治。

sentences.english: How would you like to go to the Seamens Club with me enjoy ourselves?
sentences.chinese: 跟我们一起去海员俱乐部痛痛快快玩一玩怎么样？

sentences.english: If you do accept it, HAs fun and don't be a party pooper .
sentences.chinese: 假如你决定去了，就痛痛快快地玩，别做扫兴的人。

sentences.english: A good bawl made her feel better.
sentences.chinese: 痛痛快快大哭一场使她好过些了。

sentences.english: Hagen drank the fiery liquid gratefully.
sentences.chinese: 黑根把那烈酒痛痛快快地喝了下去。

sentences.english: Who wins and who loses is no longer important, can be a good pain.
sentences.chinese: 谁赢谁输已不再重要，能痛痛快快一场就好。

sentences.english: Let's make a day of it.
sentences.chinese: 让我们痛痛快快地玩一天。

definition: delighted/to one's heart's content/straightforward/also pr. [tong4 kuai5]
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
to break even/to get one's money's worth
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
once the main problem is solved, all troubles are solved/death ends all one's troubles
to get sth off one's chest
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
